article.title: Christian_Goldbach
article.paragraph: Christian Goldbach(March 18, 1690 – November 20, 1764) was aGermanyGermanmathematicianwho also studiedlaw. He is remembered today forGoldbach's conjecture.
article.heading: Biography
article.paragraph: Born in theDuchy of Prussia's capitalKnigsberg, part ofBrandenburg-Prussia, Goldbach was the son of a pastor. He studied at theUniversity of KnigsbergRoyal Albertus University.After finishing his studies he went on long educational voyages from 1710 to 1724 through Europe, visiting other German states, England, Holland, Italy, and France, meeting with many famous mathematicians, such asGottfried Leibniz,Leonhard Euler, andNicholas I Bernoulli. Back in Knigsberg he got acquainted withGeorg Bernhard BilfingerandJakob Hermann.

He went on to work at the newly openedSt Petersburg Academy of Sciencesin 1725, as a professor of mathematics and historian of the academy.cite encyclopediaChristian GoldbachEncyclopædia Britannica16 August 2013Encyclopædia Britannica, Inc.http://www.britannica.com/EBchecked/topic/237446/Christian-Goldbach26 October 2014In 1728, whenPeter II of RussiaPeter IIbecameTsarof Russia, Goldbach became his tutor.In 1742 he entered the Russian Ministry of Foreign Affairs.cite bookRosenKenneth H.Elementary Number Theory, Fifth Edition2004Addison-Wesley0-321-23707-2

Christian Goldbach was multilingual he wrote a diary which was written in German and Latin, his letters were written in German, Latin, French, and Italian and for official documents he used Russian, German and Latin.Adolf Juskevic, Judith Kopelevic: Christian Goldbach 1690-1764 (Vita Mathematica), Birkhuser Publishing House, 1994, ISBN 3764326786, pg. XII.
He died on November 20, 1764 at age of 74, inMoscow.
article.heading: Contributions
article.paragraph: Goldbach is most noted for his correspondence withLeibniz,Euler, andDaniel BernoulliBernoulli, especially in his 1742 letter to Euler stating hisGoldbach's conjecture. He also studied and proved some theorems onperfect powers, such as theGoldbachEuler theorem, and made several notable contributions to analysis.He also proved aFermat number#Basic propertiesresultconcerningFermat numbersthat is called Goldbach's theorem.
